name: Phoenicia Diner
atmosphere: Retro 1960s diner with chrome and glass architecture, counter seating, and mountain views.
specialty: Local, seasonal diner classics with creative twists.
description: Iconic Catskills diner with a nostalgic yet modern vibe, drawing both locals and weekenders.

name: Cochecton Pump House
atmosphere: Outdoor bar and restaurant set in the ruins of an 1880s Standard Oil pumping station.
specialty: Casual elevated pub fare, rotating food trucks, and live music.
description: Unique open-air venue combining industrial history with community events and food culture.

name: Stissing House
atmosphere: Historic 18th-century tavern with rustic elegance and wood-fired hearth.
specialty: Regionally inspired, seasonal American cuisine.
description: A centuries-old tavern revitalized as a modern culinary landmark.

name: Gracie’s Luncheonette
atmosphere: Retro luncheonette with soda fountain and bright, casual interiors.
specialty: House-made comfort food and baked goods.
description: Charming roadside spot with a nostalgic yet fresh atmosphere.

name: Lil' Deb's Oasis
atmosphere: Colorful, artistic restaurant blending food with performance art and community.
specialty: Tropical comfort food and inventive cocktails.
description: Playful, inclusive space that doubles as both restaurant and art installation.

name: Roscoe Diner
atmosphere: Classic roadside diner known as a stop for travelers and fly-fishers.
specialty: Traditional American diner fare with oversized portions.
description: A Catskills institution with nostalgic small-town appeal.

name: Deer Mountain Inn
atmosphere: Rustic yet refined lodge with fireplaces, mountain art, and upscale cabin dining.
specialty: Farm-to-table New American cuisine with local sourcing.
description: An atmospheric mountain inn offering elevated dining and sweeping views.

name: Blue Hill at Stone Barns
atmosphere: Modern farmhouse setting at a working farm and education center.
specialty: Innovative farm-to-table tasting menus.
description: Michelin-starred destination restaurant redefining American farm cuisine.

name: Brushland Eating House
atmosphere: Minimalist rustic-chic space in a converted Catskills general store.
specialty: Seasonal comfort food with refined execution.
description: A sought-after rural dining experience focused on convivial, thoughtful food.

name: Peekamoose Restaurant
atmosphere: Rustic Catskills farmhouse with cozy lodge-like interiors and art installations.
specialty: Seasonal New American cuisine with local sourcing.
description: Catskills fine dining institution blending warmth, creativity, and terroir.

name: West Taghkanic Diner
atmosphere: Restored midcentury diner with contemporary design and creative flair.
specialty: Inventive comfort food and cocktails.
description: A retro diner reimagined as a modern dining and social space.

name: The Amsterdam
atmosphere: Elegant farmhouse restaurant with a blend of rustic and modern décor.
specialty: Locally sourced seasonal New American dishes.
description: Stylish Hudson Valley hotspot with sophisticated yet comfortable dining.

name: Terrapin Restaurant
atmosphere: Grand 1825 former church converted into a dramatic dining room and bistro.
specialty: Seasonal New American with Hudson Valley sourcing.
description: A Rhinebeck landmark marrying historic architecture with a lively bistro energy.

name: The Roundhouse
atmosphere: Restored 19th‑century factory complex overlooking a waterfall and creek gorge.
specialty: Modern American; strong cocktail and brunch program.
description: Atmospheric brick‑and‑beam setting with glass walls framing the falls.

name: Cochecton Fire Station
atmosphere: Revived historic firehouse with indoor/outdoor seating and rotating food pop‑ups.
specialty: Casual fare, cocktails, and events.
description: Sister venue to the Pump House with a cozy, communal vibe.

name: Prospect at Scribner’s Lodge
atmosphere: Design‑forward mountain lodge dining room with fireplaces and ridge views.
specialty: Wood‑fired, seasonal Catskills cuisine.
description: A sceney lodge restaurant perfect for post‑hike dinners and winter weekends.

name: Troutbeck Dining Room
atmosphere: Gilded‑age estate turned understated country retreat; fireplaces and salons.
specialty: Refined farm‑to‑table with a British‑country twist.
description: Gentle‑luxury Hudson Valley hideaway with soulful dining rooms.

name: The DeBruce
atmosphere: Intimate tasting‑menu lodge with panoramic river‑valley views.
specialty: Foraged, hyper‑seasonal tasting menu.
description: One of the Catskills’ most lauded destination dining rooms.

name: The Maker Restaurant
atmosphere: Sumptuous, art‑deco‑meets‑bohemian interiors in a boutique hotel.
specialty: Mediterranean‑leaning New American and craft cocktails.
description: Mood‑driven dining with lush textures and candlelit corners.

name: Wm. Farmer and Sons
atmosphere: Brick‑and‑tin ceiling tavern with vintage hotel rooms upstairs.
specialty: Hearty, seasonal tavern fare and a strong whiskey list.
description: A handsome, lived‑in space ideal for late dinners and nightcaps.

name: Rivertown Lodge Tavern
atmosphere: Midcentury cinema turned design‑centric lodge and tavern.
specialty: Small plates, natural wine, and cocktails.
description: A minimalist, wood‑warm room beloved by design nerds.

name: Ole Savannah Southern Table & Bar
atmosphere: Expansive waterfront brick foundry with outdoor decks on the Rondout Creek.
specialty: BBQ and Southern comfort staples.
description: Bustling industrial‑heritage space with marina views.

name: Diamond Mills Tavern
atmosphere: Modern dining room perched over a dramatic waterfall and dam.
specialty: Steaks, seafood, and upscale tavern fare.
description: Floor‑to‑ceiling windows put the falls front and center.

name: Hotel Kinsley (Restaurant Kinsley)
atmosphere: 19th‑century bank building with high ceilings and artful minimalism.
specialty: Seasonal New American with a sleek cocktail program.
description: Historic‑meets‑modern dining in the Stockade District.

name: The Heron
atmosphere: Riverside Main Street spot with tin ceilings and vintage touches.
specialty: Upscale comfort food and brunch.
description: Small‑town charm with big‑city execution overlooking the Delaware.

name: Callicoon Hills (The Conover Club)
atmosphere: Restored 1905 boarding house with lodge bar and vaulted dining room.
specialty: Seasonal Catskills comfort cuisine.
description: Handsome camp‑lodge energy with cocktails by the fire.

name: North Branch Inn Restaurant & Bar Room
atmosphere: Historic inn with a vintage two‑lane bowling alley and intimate dining.
specialty: Hyper‑local Catskills fare.
description: Cozy heritage setting with playful, old‑time features.

name: Kenoza Hall Restaurant
atmosphere: Revived early‑1900s lakeside resort with a bright, airy dining room.
specialty: Seasonal New American; aperitivo‑friendly.
description: Golden‑hour magnet with grand‑porch energy.

name: Bluebird Hunter Tavern
atmosphere: Modern lodge tavern with mountain‑modern interiors.
specialty: Casual alpine‑leaning comfort food.
description: After‑ski hangout with a design‑hotel polish.

name: Hutton Brickyards (Seasonal Dining)
atmosphere: Restored 19th‑century riverfront brickworks; open‑air kilns and river views.
specialty: Seasonal wood‑fired menus and events.
description: Striking Hudson waterfront campus with rotating chefs and pop‑ups.

name: American Bounty (CIA)
atmosphere: Culinary Institute of America flagship with polished open‑kitchen dining.
specialty: Farm‑driven American cuisine by student‑chefs and instructors.
description: A rite of passage for food‑obsessed Hudson Valley visitors.

name: The View (Mirror Lake Inn)
atmosphere: Refined Adirondack‑lodge dining with lake and mountain panoramas.
specialty: Seasonal fine dining with regional game and produce.
description: White‑tablecloth classic in an alpine resort town.

name: Roycroft Inn Restaurant
atmosphere: National Historic Landmark from the Arts & Crafts movement.
specialty: Classic American dishes in an arts‑and‑crafts setting.
description: Mission furniture, stained glass, and a deep sense of craft history.

name: Radio Social
atmosphere: Bowling + restaurant + lounge in a massive former factory.
specialty: Mediterranean‑leaning plates, burgers, and cocktails.
description: Playful industrial space built for groups and events.

name: The Cub Room
atmosphere: Dimly lit, clubby room with leather banquettes and a speakeasy vibe.
specialty: Steaks, chops, and classic cocktails.
description: Date‑night standby in Rochester’s South Wedge.

name: Good Luck
atmosphere: Lofty industrial dining room with dramatic bar and shareable plates.
specialty: Seasonal small plates; formidable burger.
description: Design‑savvy pioneer of Rochester’s modern dining scene.

name: Genesee Brew House Restaurant
atmosphere: Brewpub and museum with rooftop views of High Falls.
specialty: Classic pub fare and brewery‑fresh beers.
description: Sit with a pint while a 96‑ft waterfall thunders across the river.

name: FLX Table
atmosphere: Tiny communal tasting‑menu room on Linden Street.
specialty: Multi‑course seasonal menus with wine pairings.
description: An intimate Finger Lakes destination with dinner‑party energy.

name: Kindred Fare
atmosphere: Warm, wood‑and‑brick brasserie near the Seneca Lake shore.
specialty: Live‑fire grill and regional sourcing.
description: Neighborhood‑meets‑destination spot with a deep wine list.

name: 1833 Kitchen & Bar (Inns of Aurora)
atmosphere: Historic lakefront inn with genteel dining rooms and porches.
specialty: Elevated American fare with Finger Lakes wines.
description: Picture‑postcard charm on the east shore of Cayuga Lake.

name: Belhurst Castle (Edgar’s)
atmosphere: Victorian stone castle with stained glass and lake views.
specialty: Steaks, classics, and estate wines.
description: Over‑the‑top romantic setting in a bona fide castle.

name: Tailor & The Cook
atmosphere: Brick‑walled storefront with open kitchen and intimate seating.
specialty: Farm‑to‑table tasting and à la carte menus.
description: A Mohawk Valley standard‑bearer for local sourcing.

name: City Beer Hall
atmosphere: Grand former telephone company HQ with long bars and high ceilings.
specialty: Hearty pub fare and a deep draft list.
description: Rowdy in the best way—plus a mechanical bull downstairs.

name: The Mouzon House
atmosphere: Victorian house with garden patio and live jazz vibes.
specialty: Creole‑leaning farm‑to‑table.
description: Romantic, quirky, and very Saratoga.

name: Morrissey's Lounge & Bistro (The Adelphi)
atmosphere: Glam hotel lounge with gilded mirrors and vintage racing lore.
specialty: Raw bar, sushi, and bistro classics.
description: A swanky perch in one of Saratoga's crown‑jewel hotels.

name: The Amsterdam (Saratoga satellite)
atmosphere: Chic farm‑to‑table sibling to the Rhinebeck favorite.
specialty: Seasonal New American and craft cocktails.
description: Polished, lively room a short stroll from the track.
